definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: Hit Dictaphone key as many times as needed to select some application.
sentences.chinese: 口述击中关键，因为很多时候需要选择一些应用。

sentences.english: In ancient times, authors often dictated their books.
sentences.chinese: 在古代，作家通常口述其著作。

sentences.english: I wrote the letter at his dictation.
sentences.chinese: 我要口述一封信给巴托洛梅奥。

sentences.english: It was memorized by Muhammad , who then dictated it to his Companions.
sentences.chinese: 它由穆罕默德记诵，再对他的追随者口述。

sentences.english: I'm not going to have you ambushing me, either physically or verbally.
sentences.chinese: 我将没有你埋伏突袭我，也身体上地或口述地。

sentences.english: Orality never fully conceded its role to literacy and literature.
sentences.chinese: 口述从未承认它文学和艺术的作用。

sentences.english: Journal of Tsinghua University the foundation for history of mathematics laying;
sentences.chinese: 口述史在推动清华大学校史研究方面起到了积极作用。

sentences.english: I was using a dictaphone to record the conversation.
sentences.chinese: 我用的是口述录音机来记录对话。

sentences.english: Oral history plays a positive role in the study of Tsinghua University history.
sentences.chinese: 口述史在推动清华大学校史研究方面起到了积极作用。

sentences.english: I am continually grateful to my wife who is typing this letter as I dictate it to her.
sentences.chinese: 还是要感谢我的妻子，她正在将我的口述敲打成信。

sentences.english: The Old Master appeared to have dictated a message to Perino, just before his death.
sentences.chinese: 看起来这位古典大师死前口述了信息给佩里诺。

sentences.english: I wrote the letter at my boss' dictation.
sentences.chinese: 我照我老板的口述写了这封信。

sentences.english: I will dictate a letter to bartolo-mmeo .
sentences.chinese: 我要口述一封信给巴托洛梅奥。

sentences.english: But oral traditions have not disappeared.
As for the types of oral history, they are varied.
sentences.chinese: 从口述史的类型看，其具有丰富性和多样性。

sentences.english: Whenever I think of oral tradition, those moments come to mind.
sentences.chinese: 当我想到口述传统时，这些记忆就会涌现在我脑海里。

definition: to recount in one's own words/autobiography/written self-introduction
to relate (a story or information)/to tell or talk about/to recount/narration/telling/narrative/account
to repeat (one's own words or sb else's)/(in the classroom) to paraphrase what one has learned
variant of 複述|复述[fu4 shu4]
to put down in writing/to take down notes/transcript/record
